Articles.Content:
i made a spaceplane that can go almost anywhere! i did make it orbit but it takes alot of stress on it! making it so i can land on the moon and come back home,it would be easy peasy!

what do you think?
Those wings aren\'t gonna do jack on the moon, so you\'ll be landing off of thrust - better bring a lot of RCS

Those wings aren\'t gonna do jack on the moon, so you\'ll be landing off of thrust - better bring a lot of RCS

Oh boi, I can\'t wait to see newbs try and use parachutes on the moon!
oh yes. That will be hilarious fail.
Has anyone figured out/posted what the escape velocity for the Mun will be?
Assuming I\'ve not messed up my calculations, it should be about 860m/s.

That\'s a fair bit of fuel, but not impossible. Definitely gonna be leaving a stage on the surface though, Apollo-style. Actually, to make the landing easier, I might wanna try using a tank worth of descent engine which I drop when I\'m like 100m up. That way I can land on just the return stage minus a tiny bit of fuel for the last 100m.
